SEARCH
Package org.Display

Class ImmovableObjectDisplay

java.lang.Object
org.Display.ImmovableObjectDisplay
public class ImmovableObjectDisplay extends Object
Contains all logic to display carrots, mystical ocean fruit, and lava tiles to screen.

  • Constructor Details

    • ImmovableObjectDisplay

      public ImmovableObjectDisplay(Screen screen, TileManager tileM)
      Initialize fields and set initial taken positions.
      Parameters:
      screen - screen that objects are displayed on
      tileM - tile logic, containing x and y positions

  • Method Details

    • displayObjects

      public void displayObjects(int numToDisplay)
      Initialize ImmovableObject's in Screen class, placing all objects in randomized positions. For each random position generated, first check that there is not already an object at that position (using takenPositions list). Second, check that the generated position is on a valid tile (empty cave tile).
      Parameters:
      numToDisplay - number of objects to display (usually all, except when user touches a lava tile in which case only display 3 more carrots)

    • generateRandomPosition

      public int[] generateRandomPosition()
      Generate a new random position on the game board, to display a new immovable object on. Check that there is not already an object at this position and that the position is on an empty cave tile.
      Returns:
      an array of size 2, where index 0 is the x position and index 1 is the y position

    • getTakenPositions

      public ArrayList<int[]> getTakenPositions()

    • addTakenPosition

      public void addTakenPosition(int x, int y)
      Set a new position to "taken".
      Parameters:
      x - the x value of the position
      y - the y value of the position

    • removeTakenPosition

      public void removeTakenPosition(int x, int y)
      Set a given position to no longer be "taken".
      Parameters:
      x - the x value of the position
      y - the y value of the position
